{{unreferenced|date=August 2015}} {{infobox book | | name = Of Love and Other Demons | title_orig = Del amor y otros demonios | translator = [[Edith Grossman]] | image = Image:OfLoveAndOtherDemons.jpg | caption = First edition (Colombia) | author = [[Gabriel García Márquez]] | cover_artist = | country = [[Colombia]] | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]] | series = | genre = | publisher = Grupo Editorial Norma (Colombia)
[[Alfred A. Knopf]] (US) | release_date = 1994 | media_type = | pages = | isbn = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Of Love and Other Demons''''' (Spanish: '''''Del amor y otros demonios''''') is a novel by [[Colombia]]n author [[Gabriel García Márquez]], first published in 1994. In the prologue, García Márquez claims the novel is the fictional representation of a legend the author was told by his grandmother as a child: of a 12-year-old girl who contracts rabies but was believed to be a 'miracle-worker', with long flowing copper hair that continues to grow after death. In this frame-story, it was only after an excavation of tombs that García Márquez is witness to the grave of a similar young girl with long red hair still attached to the skull, that he was inspired to write ''Of Love and Other Demons''. Mariana Solanet, however, in ''García Márquez for Beginners'', states this source was invented. She points rather to a story in [[Daniel Lemaitre]]'s ''History of Cartagena'' that García Márquez came across in research for ''[[Love in the Time of Cholera]]''. In 2008, the opera ''[[Love and Other Demons]]'', by [[Hungarian people|Hungarian]] composer [[Péter Eötvös]] was premiered at the [[Glyndebourne Festival Opera|Glyndebourne Festival]]. ==Plot== ;Sierva Maria de Todos Los Angeles The twelve-year-old daughter of the Marquis and his wife Bernarda. Her hair has never been cut, and was promised to the saints when she was born with the umbilical cord around her neck. She was raised by the slaves, fluent in multiple African languages, and familiar with the customs. In the beginning of the book she is bit by a rabid dog. Even though she shows no signs of rabies, she is subject to multiple "healing" methods, which can be considered torture. She is sent to the convent of Santa Clara to receive an exorcism, which many people have died from. She receives attention from a priest, Father Cayetano, who is kind to her and initially believes she doesn't need to be exorcised. Father Cayetano falls in love with Sierva Maria and declares her his love; he soon begins visiting Sierva in her cell in secret, climbing up from the sewer (that in future is fixed). They eat, sleep, and recite poetry together, even though it doesn't appear that they are sexually involved. Later Father Cayetano is sent away to a leper hospital where he hopes to get the disease but never does. Sierva Maria in the meantime is last summoned to be exorcised and she eventually dies 'of love' wondering where Father Cayetano is and after having her hair cut. After her death her hair magically grows back on her skull. ==Film== {{main|Of Love and Other Demons (film)}} ==References== *Solanet, Mariana. ''García Márquez for Beginners''. New York: Writers and Readers, 2001. {{Gabriel García Márquez}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:1994 novels]] [[Category:Novels by Gabriel García Márquez]] [[Category:Alfred A. Knopf books]] [[Category:Fiction about exorcism]] {{1990s-novel-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2016}} {{Use British English|date=September 2016}} {{Infobox UK place | official_name= Pakefield | country= England | region= East of England | static_image= | static_image_caption = | label_position=left | os_grid_reference= | coordinates = {{coord|52.451|1.728|display=inline,title}} | post_town= LOWESTOFT | postcode_area= NR | postcode_district= NR33 | dial_code= 01502 | population = 6,563 | population_ref = (2011)<ref name=pop11>[http://www.neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/LeadKeyFigures.do?a=7&b=13694676&c=NR33+7JD&d=14&e=62&g=6467589&i=1001x1003x1032x1004&m=0&r=0&s=1442675102432&enc=1 Lowestoft Ward population 2011], Neighbourhood statistices. Retrieved 2015-09-25.</ref> | london_distance_mi= 126 | london_direction= SW | shire_county= [[Suffolk]] | shire_district=[[Waveney District|Waveney]] }}
'''Pakefield''' is a suburb of the town of [[Lowestoft]] in the [[Waveney District|Waveney]] district of the [[England|English]] county of [[Suffolk]]. Pakefield is located around {{convert|2|mi|km}} south of the centre of the town. Although today it forms a suburb of the urban area of Lowestoft, it was until 1934 a village and parish in its own right.<ref name="suffolkchurchsas">[http://www.suffolkchurches.co.uk/pakefieldas.html The Suffolk Churches site]. Retrieved 2009-11-10</ref><ref name="edp24">[http://www.edp24.co.uk/content/edp24/norfolk-life/community/Pakefield.aspx EDP24: Pakefield]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. Retrieved 2009-11-25.</ref> Pakefield lies along the [[North Sea]] coast. The former parish church, All Saints and St Margarets, is located on the coast.<ref name="suffolkchurchsas" />
Pakefield became a site of national archaeological importance in 2005 when flint tools over 700,000 years old were unearthed. This was the oldest evidence of human occupation anywhere in the UK, until flint tools at least 800,000 years old were discovered further up the coast at [[Happisburgh]] in 2010.
Pakefield has boundaries with [[Carlton Colville]] and [[Kirkley]], both also districts or suburbs of [[Lowestoft]]. It forms the southern boundary of the [[Lowestoft]] urban area with [[Kessingland]] about {{convert|2+1/2|mi|km}} to the south.
==History== Pakefield is the site of one of the earliest known areas of human habitation in the United Kingdom. In 2005 flint tools and teeth from the water vole ''Mimomys savini'', a key dating species, were found in the cliffs. This suggests that hominins can be dated in England to 700,000 years ago, potentially a cross between ''[[Homo antecessor]]'' and ''[[Homo heidelbergensis]]''.<ref name="nature1">Parfitt.S et al (2005) 'The earliest record of human activity in northern Europe', ''Nature'' 438 pp.1008-1012, 2005-12-15. Retrieved 2011-04-16.</ref><ref name="nature2">Roebroeks.W (2005) 'Archaeology: life on the Costa del Cromer', ''Nature'' 438 pp.921-922, 2005-12-15. Retrieved 2011-04-16.</ref><ref name="cba">Parfitt.S et al (2006) [http://www.britarch.ac.uk/ba/ba86/feat1.shtml '700,000 years old: found in Pakefield'], ''British Archaeology'', January/February 2006. Retrieved 2008-12-24.</ref><ref name="suffcoastarch">Good. C & Plouviez. J (2007) [http://www.suffolk.gov.uk/NR/rdonlyres/8A538AEA-ED81-498B-8525-6CE2AD89B578/0/ArchaeologyoftheSuffolkCoast.pdf The Archaeology of the Suffolk Coast] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308154227/http://www.suffolk.gov.uk/NR/rdonlyres/8A538AEA-ED81-498B-8525-6CE2AD89B578/0/ArchaeologyoftheSuffolkCoast.pdf |date=8 March 2012 }} Suffolk County Council Archaeological Service [online]. Retrieved 2009-11-28.</ref><ref name="bbcnews">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sci/tech/4526264.stm Tools unlock secrets of early man], BBC news website, 2005-12-14. Retrieved 2011-04-15.</ref>
Bloodmoor Hill, between Pakefield and Carlton Colville, was the site of settlement in the 2nd and 3rd centuries and the 7th and 8th centuries.<ref name="cau">Cambridge Archaeological Unit [http://www.eng-h.gov.uk/archcom/projects/summarys/html98_9/cc2313.htm A Roman and Saxon settlement at Bloodmoor Hill, Pakefield, Lowestoft] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606000317/http://www.eng-h.gov.uk/archcom/projects/summarys/html98_9/cc2313.htm |date=6 June 2011 }}. Retrieved 2009-11-28.</ref> The Saxon period consisted of a relatively dense settlement as well as a cemetery which included at least one rich barrow burial.<ref name="cau" /> Artefacts were discovered at the site in the 18th Century and the Saxon cemetery site was the subject of archaeological investigations between 1998 and 2006.<ref name="cau" /><ref name="engheritage">English Heritage (2008) [http://hec.english-heritage.org.uk/admisremote/HEEPOnline/Universal_detail.asp?ProjectNumber=2313 Historic Environment Enabling Programme Online - Report Detail: Bloodmoor Hill] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070901203242/http://hec.english-heritage.org.uk/admisremote/HEEPOnline/Universal_detail.asp?ProjectNumber=2313 |date=1 September 2007 }}. Retrieved 2009-11-28.</ref>
In the ''[[Domesday book]]'' Pakefield is called "Pagefella",<ref name="suckling">[[Alfred Inigo Suckling|Suckling. A.]] (1846) [http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=75134 ''The History and Antiquities of the County of Suffolk'': volume 1] [online]. Retrieved 2009-11-25.</ref> the name probably coming from the [[Pagan]] settlement name of Pagga's or Pacca's field.<ref name="edp24" /> The village was part of the [[William the Conqueror|King's]] holdings<ref name="ddmap">[http://www.domesdaymap.co.uk/place/TM5388/pakefield/ Pakefield], Domesday Map. Retrieved 2011-04-16.</ref><ref name="dd283r">''Domesday Book: folio 283r'', National Archives.</ref> and was part of the [[Mutford and Lothingland (hundred)|Hundred of Lothing]].<ref name="dd283r" /> It had a population of about 17 households, including a number of freemen.<ref name="ddmap" /><ref name="dd283r" /><ref name="dd302v">''Domesday Book: folio 302v'', National Archives.</ref><ref name="dd407v">''Domesday Book: folio 407v'', National Archives.</ref> Part of the tax payment made by the village was 600 herrings.<ref name="dd407v" />
Pakefield later developed as a [[fishing community]].<ref name="edp24" /> The former terminus of the [[Lowestoft Corporation Tramways|Tram Service from Lowestoft]] is located in the centre of Pakefield and is now the site of the Tramway Hotel.<ref name="edp24" /> In the modern era, the area played an important role in the [[Kindertransport]] programme nine months before the start of [[World War II]]. Many children who had not found prearranged [[foster care|foster families]] were given temporary shelter in the local holiday camp.<ref name="ajr">Grenville. A (2008) [http://www.ajr.org.uk/journal/issue.Nov08/article.1213 The Kindertransports 70 years on] Association of Jewish Refugees Journal, November 2008 [online]. Retrieved 2009-11-28.</ref>
==Coastal erosion== Coastal erosion has been an issue in the area for a number of years,<ref name="suffolkchurchsas" /> although this may have begun to stabilise.<ref name="edp24" /> A former lighthouse still stands on the coastline and is used by Pakefield [[National Coastwatch Institution|Coastwatch]].<ref name="sufftg">[http://www.suffolktouristguide.com/Pakefield.asp Suffolk Tourist Guide - Pakefield]. Retrieved 2009-11-28.</ref>
The map image below shows how erosion occurred between 1882 and 1955. The photos show the extent of the erosion and damage to property which occurred.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Pakefield-erosion.jpg| File:Pake-erosion1.jpg| File:Pake-erosion2.jpg| File:Pake-erosion3.jpg| </gallery>
==Governance== Pakefield sends two [[councillor]]s to [[County Council|Suffolk County Council]] and [[Non-metropolitan district|Waveney District Council]]. The [[Member of Parliament (United Kingdom)|Member of Parliament]] is elected through the [[Waveney (UK Parliament constituency)|Waveney]] seat which. For county council elections Pakefield is part of a larger constituency with the neighboring suburb of [[Carlton Colville]].
==Modern Pakefield== The coast is an important tourist destination with a number of holiday destinations, including a [[Pontins]] holiday camp.<ref name="Pontins">[http://www.pontins.com/holiday-parks/pakefield-holiday-park/ Pakefield Holiday Park], Pontins. Retrieved 2011-04-05.</ref> In November 2010 Pontins entered [[administration (law)|administration]], being taken over by the [[Britannia Hotels|Britannia Hotel Group]].<ref name="bbc6feb11">[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-12378104 Pontins to get 'Disney' makeover], BBC news website, 2011-02-06. Retrieved 2011-04-05.</ref>
The area has a number of local shops and businesses,<ref name="edp24" /> including [[The Seagull (theatre)|The Seagull]] theatre and cinema. As well as the church of All Saint's and St Margaret's, Pakefield has a catholic church dedicated to St Nicholas.<ref name="suffolkchurchesstni">[http://www.suffolkchurches.co.uk/pakefieldrc.html The Suffolk Churches site - Pakefield St Nicholas]. Retrieved 2009-11-10.</ref>
It also has a primary school and a high school. The primary school was awarded a grant by the [[Royal Society]] in 2009 to develop a project called 'What has the sea ever done for us'.<ref name="royalsoc">[http://royalsociety.org/education/partnership/pakefield-primary/ Pakefield Primary School], The Royal Society, 2009. Retrieved 2011-04-20.</ref> [[Pakefield School]] opened in September 2011 as part of a reorganisation of education in Lowestoft. This involved the closure of Pakefield Middle School and an extension of the primary school to take children up until the end of year 6. The high school took over the middle school site and buildings.<ref name="scclow">[http://www.suffolk.gov.uk/EducationAndLearning/Schools/SuffolkSchoolOrganisationReview/Lowestoft+school+organisation+review.htm Schools in Lowestoft and the surrounding area] Suffolk County Council. Retrieved 2009-09-11</ref><ref name="sccsor">[http://www.suffolk.gov.uk/EducationAndLearning/Schools/SuffolkSchoolOrganisationReview/Listing.htm School Organisation Review] Suffolk County Council. Retrieved 2009-09-11.</ref>
The Promoting Pakefield Group was formed in 2004 to attempt to promote the area and its interests. A variety of local improvements have been made, including providing a Christmas tree, noticeboards and making improvements to the local war memorial.<ref name="Lowestoft Network Page 3 to right and all of page 4">[http://www.waveney.gov.uk/NR/rdonlyres/0CC55583-3DEC-4459-A30E-ACD52082758E/0/cultural_network_newsletter_spring09.pdf Lowestoft Network]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} pp.3-4. Retrieved 2009-09-12.</ref> The group is made up of a number of local businesses and other organisations.
==Notable people== The author and illustrator [[Michael Foreman (author / illustrator)|Michael Foreman]] was born in Pakefield in 1938<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1027062/|title=Michael Foreman|work=IMDb}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theweeweb.co.uk/public/author_profile.php?id=260|title=Ladybird Books at The Wee Web|work=theweeweb.co.uk}}</ref> and attended Pakefield Primary School.<ref name="darkness">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2004/feb/19/popandrock2?INTCMP=SRCH|title=Lowestoft's Dark stars|work=the Guardian}}</ref> He has written about Pakefield in his books.
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== {{commonscat|Pakefield}} *[http://www.pakefield.org/ Love Pakefield Tourist Information] *{{Dmoz|Regional/Europe/United_Kingdom/England/Suffolk/Pakefield}}
[[Category:Populated coastal places in Suffolk]] [[Category:Lowestoft]] [[Category:Stone Age sites in England]] [[Category:Paleoanthropological sites]]

A '''patakí''' is a brief story used in [[Santería]] and [[Ifá]].
==Definition== “Oral narratives of the Lucumí faith, religious stories [are] known to practitioners as patakís.”<ref name=Lele>Lele, Ócháni. ''Diloggún Tales of the Natural World: How the Moon Fooled the Sun, and Other Santería Stories''. Rochester, Vt: Destiny Books, 2011. Print.</ref>{{rp|viii}} A patakí can be likened to a Christian parable. Santería initiates use the short fables to teach and illustrate a moral lesson to followers. The patakí is passed down orally through generations of Santería initiates. “Some patakís narrate the birth or death of an [[Orisha]] in human form. Others deal with relationships between Orishas.”<ref name=Duncan>Duncan, Cynthia. Personal Interview. 15 May 2012.</ref> These stories offer advice to followers on how to deal with life’s issues. The patakís also serve as creation stories on how the natural world came into being. The moral lessons of the patakí have a range of themes, such as respecting your elders, how to be humble and grateful for what you have, not underestimating your enemy, knowing who is your friend and who is not. Patakís are written in an artful narrative style. They are usually set in an ancient time when the Orishas were still in human form. Patakís are “part of this enormous mine of oral lucumí literature”.<ref>Dianteill, Erwan, and Martha Swearingen. "From Hierography to Ethnography and Back: Lydia Cabrera's Texts and the Written Tradition in Afro-Cuban Religions." Journal of American Folklore. 116.461 (2003). Print.</ref>{{rp|7}}
==Oral tradition== “Most [[babalawo|babaaláwo]]s are experts on the patakís and memorize a large corpus of them, although it is impossible to say how many patakís exist in an oral tradition that spans centuries. Some Santeros/as are also familiar with the patakís, but it is not a requirement for Santeros/as to memorize the stories in order to practice the religion. Where the patakí fits into this system is unique, because they are taught in Ilés and depending on the Ilé the same patakí might have slight variation. Newly initiated Babaaláwos are taught patakís and other secrets of the religion by Padrinos and for their first years study quite intensely. Aside from libretas, which are private religious notebooks used for passing down rituals and traditions, there is a slight distrust for things written in a book.<ref name=Lele />
==Understanding the patakí== Interpretation and use of patakí text by babaaláwos is based on a system of [[Ifá#Odù Ifá|Odu]]. The original oral literature is kept intact but was applied to the marginality the Afro-Cuban faced in the New World.<ref name=Lele /> The esoteric nature in which the patakí is situated also allows for hidden meaning in the ‘writings’. Patakís may be written in libretas but many are memorized from oral transmission.
There are many discrepancies on pronunciations, and written forms of some of the Yoruba words in Lucumí literature. Many words are [[Spanish language|Spanish.]] Because there is no standard format, many versions of words and some variation on the practices exist. "The existence of the word as something usable in utterances presupposes a collective understanding of its existence."<ref name=Agha>{{cite journal|last=Agha|first=Asif|title=The Social Life of Cultural Value|journal=Language & Communication|year=2003|volume=23|issue=3|pages=231–273|doi=10.1016/s0271-5309(03)00012-0}}</ref>{{rp|245}} The entire religious community has acknowledged the practices, traditions and words of Santería and other divination elements such as the patakí and therefore it has become legitimate collective knowledge. The transculturation that created Santería and many other Afro-Cuban traditions has become a part of national identity. What is most important about the patakí is that the original idea, or moral of the story remain intact through translation and interpretation.<ref name="Duncan" />
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Pataki}} [[Category:Oral tradition]] [[Category:Santería]]

revision.text:
'''Public float''' or '''free float''' represents the portion of [[Share (finance)|shares]] of a [[corporation]] that are in the hands of public investors as opposed to locked-in stock held by promoters, company officers, controlling-interest investors, or government. This number is sometimes seen as a better way of calculating [[market capitalization]] because it provides a more accurate reflection (than entire market capitalization) of what public investors consider the company to be worth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/freefloatmethodology.asp |title=Free-Float Methodology |publisher=investopedia |accessdate=June 17, 2013}}</ref>
In this context, the ''float'' may refer to all the [[shares outstanding]] that can be publicly traded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.investorwords.com/3936/public_float.html|title=What is Public Float? definition and meaning|author=|date=|website=InvestorWords.com}}</ref>
== Calculating public float == The float is calculated by subtracting the locked-in shares from outstanding shares. For example, a company may have 10 million outstanding shares, with 3 million of them in a locked-in position; this company's float would be 7 million. Stocks with smaller floats tend to be more [[Volatility (finance)|volatile]] than those with larger floats. In general, the large holdings of founding shareholders, corporate cross-holdings, and government holdings in partially [[privatized]] companies are excluded when calculating the size of a public float.
== Process of public floatation== There are certain regulations to offer public floats, though these regulations might differ from region to region.
For instance to offer public float in the UK, a company must be incorporated, i.e. be a public limited liability company under UK law. Also, the company should have published or filed audit accounts for at least a three-year period, have trading and revenue earning records for at least three years, its higher management and directors must be competent enough to run a business at that scale, and the company must show that it has a working capital for at least 12 months. Moreover, once the company is listed, the business must be independent from any shareholder with controlling interest (anyone owning more than 30% of the company shares), and after the company is listed, at least 25% of its shares must be in the hands of general public, that is public float, and the company must have a total market capitalization of not less than £700,000.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|last1=London Stock Exchange|title=A practical guide to listing|url=http://www.londonstockexchange.com/companies-and-advisors/listing/float/practical-guide-to-listing.pdf|publisher=London Stock Exchange}}</ref>
== Advantages of public floating ==
===Greater access to funds===
By public floating, companies gain access to new and large capital as general public can invest in the company making it easy for the company to get capital.<ref name="auto1">{{cite web|website=Ernst and Young|title=EY's guide to going public|url=http://www.ey.com/Publication/vwLUAssets/Ernst_and_Young_guide_to_going_public/$FILE/Guide_to_Going_Public.pdf}}</ref> This new capital is then used to increase company's profits <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/facebook/9273583/Facebook-valued-at-104bn-on-record-breaking-stock-market-debut.html|title=Facebook valued at $104bn on record-breaking stock market debut|first=Katherine|last=Rushton|date=17 May 2012|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref>
===Opportunities to reduce debt ===
By public floating company gains access to interest free capital as there is no interest to be paid on shares. Though dividend is involved but terms of dividend are far more flexible than terms for loans.<ref name="auto1"/> Along with this shares are not considered as a debt and by public floating companies can reduce their debts creating a better asset liability ratio.
===Enhancement of credibility and higher public profile===
By public floating companies can enhance their credit image.<ref name="auto1"/> As banks and other credit providing institutions provide credit more often to a public limited company along with this sometimes favorable terms are also offered by credit providers because of public limited company status. Along with enhanced credibility companies can also get higher media coverage and attention of general public.<ref name="auto"/>
== Disadvantages of public floating ==
===Company is open to market fluctuations===
By public floating companies are vulnerable to threats of speculations and market fluctuations. During the 2008 financial crisis several companies went bankrupt because of fluctuations in the stock market severely limiting their operating capital to the extent that they were unable to pay their creditors and were forced to liquidate their operational assets.
===Costs of public flotation===
Costs of company registration are also very high making it difficult for certain small businesses to public float. Along with higher costs processes of registering and running a company are also very complex.<ref name="auto2">{{cite web|website=Gov.uk|title=Running a limited company|url=https://www.gov.uk/running-a-limited-company/company-and-accounting-records}}</ref> For example, in the UK, in order to run a public limited company, a register of the directors, shareholders, and any shareholder votes, as well as all details of the company's finances must be compiled and kept for a minimum of six years. Along with this a comprehensive accounting record is also needed like sales and whom they are made to (until and unless it is a retail business), Purchases and from whom they are done stock and debts all of them are necessary to be provided.<ref name="auto2"/> Along with all these costs, taxes are also to be paid while a company is public floating. For instance in the UK a company has to pay corporation tax which is 20% if the profit per year is £300,000 or less and 21% if profit is above £300,000.
===Pressure to perform===
Public floating also increases pressure on a company to perform. Whenever the general public, as company shareholders, demand dividends without keeping the company's economic circumstances in proper perspective, it increases performance pressure on the company.<ref name="auto1"/> Secondly, sometimes companies provide false financial reports to sell shares which lead towards further complications in market. In 2005, AIG had to pay a fine of $1.7 billion as a result of improper accounting.<ref>{{cite web|last1=CNN|title=Greenberg settles AIG charges for $15 million|url=http://money.cnn.com/2009/08/06/news/companies/Greenberg_SEC/}}</ref> Additionally, Lehman Brothers went bankrupt in 2008 after using a small firm to secretly manipulate its balance sheets.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Wolff|first1=Richard|title=Lehman Brothers financially and morally bankrupt|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/cifamerica/2011/dec/12/lehman-brothers-bankrupt}}</ref> Both cases illustrate that, as a result of pressure to sell shares, companies may manipulate their financial statements, and later face the consequences (Lehman Brothers' bankruptcy in 2008, AIG's bailout by the U.S government in 2008).
===Less public float===
Less public float may cause illiquidity of stocks of companies due to the low public holdings. One may not be able to transact buy or sell orders on a respected stock exchange.
==See also== *[[Concentrated stock]] *[[Market capitalization]] *[[Open market]] *[[Restricted stock]] *[[Shares authorized]] *[[Shares outstanding]] *[[Treasury stock]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{stock market}}
[[Category:Corporate finance]] [[Category:Fundamental analysis]] [[Category:Stock market]] [[Category:Public sphere|Float]]
[[hu:Részvény]]

{{See also|Cuisine|Global cuisine|List of cuisines}} [[File:India food.jpg|thumb|230px|[[Hyderabadi Biryani]], an [[India]]n meat and rice dish.]]
'''Regional cuisine''' is [[cuisine]] based upon national, state or local regions.<ref>[http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/region "Region."] (Definition). [http://www.merriam-webster.com Merriam-Webster dictionary]. Accessed June 2011.</ref> Regional cuisines may vary based upon [[food]] availability and trade, varying [[climate]]s, [[cooking]] traditions and practices, and [[culture|cultural]] differences.<ref name="cuisine">[http://www.eldrbarry.net/hatr/eldrcuis.htm "The American Food Revolutions: Cuisines in America."] [http://www.eldrbarry.net Eldrbarry.net]. Accessed June 2011.</ref> One noteworthy definition is based upon ''traditional cuisine'': "A traditional cuisine is a coherent tradition of food preparation that rises from the daily lives and kitchens of a people over an extended period in a specific region of a country, or a specific country, and which, when localized, has notable distinctions from the cuisine of the country as a whole."<ref name="cuisine"/> Regional food preparation traditions, customs and ingredients often combine to create dishes unique to a particular region.<ref>[http://whatscookingamerica.net/AmericanRegionalFoods/RegionalAmericanIndex.htm "Rediscover the flavors and traditions of true American cuisine!"] [http://whatscookingamerica.net Whatscookingamerica.net]. Accessed June 2011.</ref> Regional cuisines are often named after the geographic areas or regions that they originate from.<ref name="cuisine"/>
<gallery class="center" caption="" widths="200px" heights="150px"> File:Pub grub.jpg|[[Pub grub#Pub grub|Pub grub]] - a [[pie]], along with a [[beer|pint]]. [[Public house]]s are a part of [[British culture|British]],<ref name="EB">[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/482410/public-house Public House] Britannica.com; Subscription Required. Retrieved 03-07-08.</ref> [[Culture of Ireland#Food and drink|Irish]],<ref>{{cite book|last=Cronin|first=Michael|author2=O'Connor, Barbara|title=Irish Tourism: image, culture, and identity |editor=Barbara O'Connor|publisher=Channel View Publications|year=2003|series=Tourism and Cultural Change|volume=1|page=83|isbn= 978-1-873150-53-5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mLkIW-c4dScC&pg=PA83}}</ref> [[Scottish culture|Scottish]],<ref>[http://www.insiders-scotland-guide.com/ScottishPubs.html "Find Your Local! - All about Scottish Pubs."] [http://www.insiders-scotland-guide.com Insiders-scotland-guide.com]. Accessed July 2011.</ref> and [[Australian culture]].<ref>(Australian) [http://www.convictcreations.com/culture/drinking.htm "Drinking etiquette."] Convict Creations. Retrieved 24-04-11.</ref> File:Southernfood.jpg|American [[Cuisine of the Southern United States|Southern food]] is often traditional, or "old-fashioned", as seen on a sign for the Granny Cantrell's restaurants in the [[Florida Panhandle]]. </gallery>
==See also== {{portal|Cuisine|Food|Drink|Culture}} * [[Hawaii regional cuisine]] * [[Japanese regional cuisine]] * [[List of regional dishes of the United States]] * [[List of street food|List of street foods around the world]] * [[Fusion cuisine]] * [[National dish]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.enotes.com/food-encyclopedia/ eNotes - Encyclopedia of Food and Culture] *[http://cs-www.cs.yale.edu/homes/hupfer/global/gastronomer.html The Global Gastronomer - Cuisines of the World]
{{cuisine}}

revision.text:
{{accuracy|date=March 2017}}
[[File:Civilian Conservation Corps, Third Corps Area, typing class with W.P.A. instructor - NARA - 197144.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Civilian Conservation Corps typing class, 1933]] In a '''speed typing contest''' contestants compete to attain the highest accurate [[typing]] speeds.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.telecompaper.com/news/telenor-to-start-qualifications-for-sms-speed-typing-contest | title=Telenor to start qualifications for SMS speed typing contest | publisher=[http://www.telecompaper.com Telecompaper.com] | date=October 21, 2010 | accessdate=January 9, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://eon.businesswire.com/news/eon/20100308005492/en/Das-Keyboard/keyboard/Model-S | title=Country’s First Ultimate Typing Champion to be Crowned at SXSW Interactive | publisher=[http://eon.businesswire.com Enhanced Online News] | date=March 8, 2010 | accessdate=January 9, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/dgkeysearchdetail.cfm?trg=1&strucID=1792154&imageID=1668009&parent_id=1785129&word=&snum=0&s=1&notword=&d=&c=&f=&k=3&sScope=&sLevel=&sLabel=&total=17&num=0&imgs=20&pNum=&pos=17 | title=Contests - Winner of speed typing contest with prize typewriter | publisher=[http://digitalgallery.nypl.org New York Public Library Digital Gallery] | accessdate=January 9, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.catholic.org/hf/family/story.php?id=27357 | title=Typing contest teaches keyboard skills — needed even in the computer age | publisher=[http://www.catholic.org Catholic.org] (News) | date=March 28, 2008 | accessdate=January 9, 2012 | author=Lovejoy-Voss, Kim }}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/193505/ipad_vs_laptop_vs_netbook_vs_iphone_typing_test.html | title=iPad vs. Laptop vs. Netbook vs. iPhone: Typing Test | publisher=[http://www.pcworld.com PC World] | date=April 5, 2010 | accessdate=January 9, 2012 | author=McCracken, Harry}}</ref> These contests have been common in [[North America]] since the 1930s and were used to test the relative efficiency of typing with the [[Dvorak Simplified Keyboard|Dvorak]] and [[QWERTY]] keyboard layouts.<ref>Readings in Applied Microeconomics: The Power of the Market, Craig Newmark, p. 219 - 220</ref><ref>Human Motor Control, David A. Rosenbaum, p. 305</ref>
==Touchscreen keyboards==
As of 2015, there were diverse claims regarding the fastest typing in [[smartphone]]s and other [[touchscreen]] devices with [[virtual keyboard|on-screen keyboards]]. The typical [[yardstick]] is writing, with no [[Typographical error|mistakes]], the 160-character text:
:''The razor-toothed [[piranha]]s of the genera [[Serrasalmus]] and [[Pygocentrus]] are the most ferocious [[freshwater fish]] in the world. In reality they seldom attack a [[human]].''
A disputed issue is whether [[Autocorrection|auto-correct]] and [[Predictive text|predictive features]] should be allowed. Common sense indicates that they shouldn't, because when typing the record phrase several times the phone [[Machine learning|learns the text]]. Speed depends, then, on the phrase being repeated, a poor indicator of performance for everyday use. In the extreme, the phone could learn to predict "Serrasalmus" when typing just "Ser", but that would be extremely uncomfortable in normal circumstances ("[[wikt:ser|ser]]" is the Spanish word for "[[Be (verb)|being]]"). In fact, [[Guinness World Records]] establishes that "To qualify for the record, no autocorrect or predictive text features are allowed to remain on".<ref>[http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/corporate/2014/5/fastest-touch-screen-text-message-record-officially-broken-with-fleksy-keyboard-57380-57388 Fastest touch-screen text message record officially broken with Fleksy keyboard]</ref>
In March 2010, [[Samsung]] posted a 35.54-second record with predictive texting, but no actual [[footage]].<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WAh-FqEizi4 Guinness World Record for Texting Challenge]</ref> Later that year, [[Swype]], a predictive keyboard for [[Android (operating system)|Android]] and [[iOS]] where users swipe their fingers across the keyboard to enter one word per stroke, claimed a record of 25.94 seconds, but with prediction features on.<ref>[http://phandroid.com/2010/08/24/text-message-speed-record-broken-thanks-to-swype-on-the-samsung-galaxy-s/ Text Message Speed Record Broken Thanks to Swype on the Samsung Galaxy S]</ref> A [[YouTube]] user later claimed to have set a 21.8-second record on an [[iPhone]], but the posted video clearly showed autocorrect enabled and correcting at least four mistakes.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVXyVzLjKag Text messaging world record? I beat that (less than 21.8 seconds)!]</ref>
In April 2014, in the midst of a publicity campaign for [[Windows Phone 8.1]], [[Microsoft Research]] published a new record of 18.44 seconds, also with predictive features on.<ref>[http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/news/features/wordflow-040414.aspx Microsoft Brings World’s Fastest Texting to Windows Phone 8.1]</ref> This record, obviously dependent on pre-learning by the keyboard's memory, became the object of mockery on the web.<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w_lXTtMa2xg</ref> It was broken the next month when a time of 18.19 seconds was alleged by Brazilian youngster Marcel Fernandes Filho using the [[Flesky]] mobile keyboard on an Android phone.<ref>[http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2014/5/fastest-touch-screen-text-message-record-officially-broken-with-fleksy-keyboard-57380/ Fastest touch-screen text message record officially broken with Fleksy keyboard]</ref> While the firm claimed it was without autocorrection, video footage clearly contradicted this (e.g., the letter "B" was pressed when writing "genera"); furthermore, only a portion of the complete taping was displayed. This alleged record was admitted by Guinness in spite of violating its own rules of having the autocorrect feature off. Also, a [[dash]] (crucial for the record) appeared in the main keyboard, which was never a part of Fleksy's main screen. Thus, questions arose as to whether Guinness had been object of a [[misinformation]] scheme or even a party in it.<ref>[http://www.exideas.com/ME/GamesAndContests.php How were the Guinness People Duped?]</ref> In November 2014, Fleksy claimed Mr Fernandes Filho had broken his own record on a larger phone, but later removed the video.<ref>[http://fleksy.com/dropping-price-breaking-world-records/ We’re dropping price, and breaking world records (again)!]</ref>
In 2015, TipType, a [[WYSIWYG|What-You-Type-Is-What-You-Get]] keyboard with a QWERTY layout but based on sliding movements rather than pressing (similar to Swype), launched a speed contest for phones of traditional size. The company posted a 25-second record with a [[Samsung Galaxy S3 mini]] on YouTube and promised [[USD]] 500 to anyone bettering that record on a touchscreen of size 4.5" or less, subject to Guinness World Records rules.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n6S_5fquM7E TipType Challenge, march 2015]</ref>
==By country==
===Malaysia=== [[Malaysia]] began holding an annual contest in 2011. Each participant must pass a certain [[words per minute]] (WPM) to be eligible for the final live competition. The contest was jointly organized by team a students, JCI Mines and AYFIC Project.<ref>[http://www.yim.my/AYFIC2011/index.cfm?&menuid=86{{dead link|date=December 2014}} AYFIC 2011 - ReSearch.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> It receives support from Microsoft Malaysia, Malaysian Book of Records (MBR), Multimedia Development Corporation (MDeC), Multimedia IT Society, HYJ Wushu Academy and Blogmakeover, as well as various government agencies. The contest soft launched on 1 July 2011, including a press conference that received Chinese newspaper coverage.<ref>[http://www.speedtypingcontest.com/2011/11/kuala-lumpur-innovation-forum-klif.html STC at Kuala Lumpur Innovation Forum (KLIF) | speedtypingcontest<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The initial stage is open to all regardless of age.<ref name=autogenerated1>[http://www.speedtypingcontest.com/?page_id=123 FAQ + About Us | speedtypingcontest<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The 200 fastest entrants enter the final stage.<ref name=autogenerated1 /> Given a 5-minute time slot, participants can have unlimited 1-minute time trials keeping their best result.
The winner of the 2011 tournament was Shaun Low Foo Shern, with a speed of 146 words per minute.<ref>[http://speedtypingcontest.blogspot.com.au/2011/12/thank-you.html ]</ref>
==In films== The 2012 French romantic comedy-drama film ''[[Populaire (film)|Populaire]]'' shows the relationship between a speed typist and her trainer.
==See also== * [[Ultimate Typing Championship]]
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Language competitions]] [[Category:Typing]]

{{Infobox book | name = The Female Brain | image = The Female Brain (book).jpg| author = [[Louann Brizendine]] | cover_artist = | publisher = Morgan Road Books | release_date = 2006 | media_type = Print (hardcover) | pages = 187, 210 including notes. | size_weight = | isbn = 0-7679-2009-0| dewey= 612.8 22 | congress= QP376 .B755 2006 | oclc= 63660885 }}
'''''The Female Brain''''' is a 2006 book by the American [[neuropsychiatrist]] [[Louann Brizendine]]. The main thesis of the book is that women's behavior is different from that of men due, in large measure, to [[hormone|hormonal]] differences. Brizendine says that the human female brain is affected by the following hormones: [[estrogen]], [[progesterone]], [[testosterone]], ([[oxytocin]]), [[neurotransmitters]] ([[dopamine]], [[serotonin]]), and that there are differences in the architecture of the [[brain]] (prefrontal [[Cerebral cortex|cortex]], [[hypothalamus]], [[amygdala]]) that regulates such hormones and [[neurotransmitter]]s.
==Structure== ''The Female Brain'' has seven chapters, each one of which is dedicated to a specific part of a woman's life such as [[puberty]], motherhood, and [[menopause]], or a specific dimension of a women’s emotional life such as feelings, [[love]] and [[trust (social sciences)|trust]], and [[sex]]. The book also includes three appendices on [[hormone therapy]], [[postpartum depression]], and [[sexual orientation]].
== Reception == The book sold well but received mixed reviews, because there was some controversy from feminist writers about the validity of some of the content. Some of the authors that supported the content of the book include: * [[Deborah Tannen]], of the ''[[The Washington Post]]''<ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/08/18/AR2006081800429_pf.html 'A Brain of One's Own'.] ''[[The Washington Post]]'' August 20, 2006.</ref> Tannen writes, "Throughout the book, I recognized biological accounts for social behaviors I had observed and written about." In a similar vein, she adds, "Anthropologists and linguists who have studied children at play have noted that girls form bonds by telling secrets. Here, too, Brizendine finds 'a biological reason.'" Her ultimate position is one of cautionary endorsement: "Ideally, readers will sift through the case studies, research findings and scientific conjectures gathered in this non-technical book and be intrigued by some while questioning others, bearing in mind the caution that hormones and brain structure play a role in gender differences but are not the whole story." * [[Sarah Hrdy]], author of ''Mother Nature'' * [[Daniel Goleman]] author of ''[[Emotional Intelligence]]''
Some of the authors that criticized the content of the book include: * [[Evan Balaban]] and [[Rebecca M. Young]], in a review in ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]''<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Young | first1 = Rebecca M. | last2 = Balaban | first2 = Evan | title = Psychoneuroindoctrinology | journal = [[Nature (journal)|Nature]] | volume = 443 | issue = 7112 | page = 634 | publisher = [[Nature Publishing Group]] | doi = 10.1038/443634a | date = 12 October 2006 | url = https://doi.org/10.1038/443634a | ref = harv | postscript = .}} [https://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v443/n7112/pdf/443634a.pdf Pdf.] :Evan Balaban and Rebecca M. Young called ''The Female Brain'' a "melodrama" "riddled with scientific errors" and "fail[ing] to meet even the most basic standards of scientific accuracy and balance" and that "human sex differences are elevated almost to the point of creating different species, yet virtually all differences in brain structure, and most differences in behaviour, are characterized by small average differences and a great deal of male–female overlap at the individual level".</ref> * [[Cordelia Fine]], in her book ''[[Delusions of Gender]]''<ref>{{Cite book|last=Fine |first=Cordelia | author-link = Cordelia Fine |title=Delusions of Gender: How Our Minds, Society, and Neurosexism Create Difference |publisher=W. W. Norton & Company, 2010 }}</ref> *[[Benjamin Radford]]<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20121110091245/http://news.discovery.com/human/how-different-are-male-and-female-brains.html How different are male and female brains?] (from [[Wayback Machine]])</ref> *[[Robin Marantz Henig]] in ''[[The New York Times]]''<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2006/09/10/books/review/Henig.t.html?_r=1 How Women Think]</ref> * Professor [[Mark Liberman]] in a series of articles via his ''Language Log'' blog<ref>{{cite web | last = Liberman | first = Mark | author-link = Mark Liberman | title = David Brooks, Neuroendocrinologist | url = http://itre.cis.upenn.edu/~myl/languagelog/archives/003586.html | website = upenn.edu/~myl/languagelog | publisher = [[Mark Liberman]] | date = 17 September 2006 | access-date = 19 August 2017}} :List of Liberman's other posts on Louann Brizendine's ''The Female Brain'' at bottom of web page.</ref>
Academic [[feminist]]s have given mixed reviews to ''The Female Brain''. Brizendine was given the tongue-in-cheek 2006 [[Language Log|Becky Award]], which is given to "people or organizations who have made outstanding contributions to linguistic misinformation".<ref>[http://www.languagehat.com/archives/002602.php 2006 Becky Award]</ref> The award cited errors in ''The Female Brain'', including one sentence (removed from subsequent printings) which contrasted the number of words used by men and women in one day. The numbers had been taken from a book by a self-help guru and were incorrect.<ref>"[http://www.ischool.berkeley.edu/~nunberg/beckies.html The Language of Eve]", Geoffrey Nunberg, January 3, 2007</ref>
== Response to criticisms == Brizendine later made some concessions to those who felt that this book overemphasised gender-based differences, saying: "Males and females are more alike than they are different. After all, we are the same species".<ref name=calmag>{{cite journal|last1=Tugend|first1=Alina|title=Engendering Sons|journal=[[California (magazine)|California]]|issue=Winter 2014|pages=48–49}}</ref>
== In other media == {{Main|The Female Brain (film)}}
''The Female Brain'' was loosely adapted as a romantic comedy movie of the same name in 2017. Brizendine served as the inspiration for the film's main character.<ref name=movie>{{cite web |url=http://psych.ucsf.edu/news/female-brain-movie-premieres-los-angeles |title='The Female Brain' movie premieres in Los Angeles |last=Roznovsky |first=Nicholas |date=27 June 2017 |website=UCSF Psychiatry News |publisher=UCSF Department of Psychiatry |access-date=5 July 2017}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Biology of gender]] *''[[Brain Gender]]'' *''[[Brain Sex]]''

{{Infobox film | name = The Happytime Murders | image = The Happytime Murders.png | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Brian Henson]] | producer = {{Plainlist| * Brian Henson * Jeffrey Hayes * [[Melissa McCarthy]] * [[Ben Falcone]] }} | story = {{Plainlist| * Todd Berger * Dee Austin Robertson }} | screenplay = [[Todd Berger]] | starring = {{Plainlist|<!--Per poster billing--> * Melissa McCarthy * [[Maya Rudolph]] * [[Joel McHale]] * [[Elizabeth Banks]] }} | music = [[Christopher Lennertz]] | cinematography = [[Mitchell Amundsen]] | editing = Brian Scott Olds | studio = {{Plainlist| * [[STX Entertainment|STX Films]] * [[Huayi Brothers|H. Brothers]] * [[Black Bear Pictures]] * [[Donald Tang|TMP]] * [[The Jim Henson Company]] * [[On the Day Productions]] }} | distributor = [[STX Entertainment]]
| released = {{Film date|2018|8|24|United States}} | runtime = 91 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = $40–47 million<ref name=opening/> | gross = $27.5 million<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=thehappytimemurders.htm|title=The Happytime Murders (2018)|website=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=September 23, 2018}}</ref> }} '''''The Happytime Murders''''' is a 2018 American [[black comedy]] [[crime film]] directed by [[Brian Henson]] and written by [[Todd Berger]]. The film stars [[Melissa McCarthy]], [[Maya Rudolph]], [[Joel McHale]], [[Elizabeth Banks]], and [[Bill Barretta]]. The plot, set in a world where puppets and humans co-exist, follows a joint police force who must solve a recent murder spree of retired sitcom stars.
The film was first announced in 2008 by [[The Jim Henson Company]], the production studio of [[The Muppets|Muppets]] creator [[Jim Henson]]. Various actors, including [[Cameron Diaz]], [[Katherine Heigl]], and [[Jamie Foxx]], were approached to star before McCarthy signed on in May 2017. Filming began in [[Los Angeles]] that September, and involved the use of over 120 puppets. The release marks the film debut of Henson Alternative, a banner of The Jim Henson Company that specializes in adult content.
''The Happytime Murders'' was released on August 24, 2018, by [[STX Entertainment|STXfilms]]. It received generally negative reviews from critics and was a [[Box-office bomb|box office bomb]], grossing only $27.5 million worldwide against a total of its $87 million budget.
==Plot== <!-- Per WP:FILMPLOT, plot summaries for feature films should be between 400 to 700 words. --> In a world where puppets coexist with humans but are treated as [[second-class citizens]], Phil Phillips was the first puppet cop on the [[Los Angeles Police Department]] (LAPD) before being fired. Now a private detective with a human secretary Bubbles, he is hired by puppet client Sandra to find out who has been blackmailing her. Phil investigates a lead at a puppet-owned porn shop and while he goes in the back to check their records an attacker kills everyone present, including Bumblypants, a cast member of “The Happytime Gang”, a puppet sitcom that was due to go into syndication.
The LAPD arrive and Phil meets up with his former partner, Detective Connie Edwards. Twelve years prior, Edwards was being held at gunpoint by a puppet criminal. Phil tried to shoot him but missed and hit an innocent puppet, killing him in front of the puppet's young daughter. Edwards and the thug exchanged fire; Edwards was wounded but the thug was killed. Edwards received a puppet liver transplant which left her with an addiction to sugar which is like heroin to puppets. Edwards testified against Phil and a law was enacted preventing puppets from being cops.
Back in the present, Edwards believes it was a robbery gone wrong but Phil believes it was murder. That night Phil’s brother Larry "Shenanigans" Phillips, former Happytime cast-member, is torn apart when someone lets dogs into his house. Phil reluctantly teams up with Edwards to find the killer.
The two track down former Happytime cast member Lyle only for him to be killed in a drive-by shooting in front of Phil. Phil goes to see Jenny, the only human Happytime cast member and his former girlfriend, at a puppet strip club where she works. Phil is unable to protect her when her car explodes apparently killing her. The police see Phil leaving the scene and believe him to be responsible for the murders.
Phil hides out at Edwards' apartment and they discover that homeless sugar addict and former Happytime member Goofer has apparently overdosed and drowned. They go the house of the two remaining Happytime Gang members Ezra and Cara only to find their mangled bodies. The [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] (FBI) shows up and Phil and Edwards are detained.
Phil is shown Sandra in an interrogation room. She reveals that she and Jenny are married and claims Phil killed Jenny and the others, to keep Sandra for himself.
Edwards is suspended from duty, and finds Bubbles to ask for help proving Phil's innocence. They break into Sandra's place and come across a hidden room with plans for the deaths of the Happytime Gang and a conspiracy against Phil. Edwards notices a picture of the puppet who Phil accidentally shot years ago and realizes that Sandra is his daughter, and that she is out for revenge against Phil. Bubbles sees a tape recorder and presses the play button, which ignites a fire destroying all the evidence. Edwards breaks Phil out of jail to stop Sandra.
Phil and Edwards get to the airport where Sandra is planning to escape with all the royalty money. Phil apologizes for killing her father, saying it has haunted him all the years since, and asks why the Happytime Gang had to die. Sandra says she wanted Phil to suffer as payback. It turns out that Jenny is alive, having faked her death, and is in cahoots with Sandra, but Sandra knocks Jenny out to take the money for herself after Philips reveals her true history. Sandra holds Edwards at gunpoint, putting her and Phil in the same position as twelve years before. Phil takes his shot and doesn't miss this time, killing Sandra.
Banning arrives to congratulate Phil and Edwards on cracking the case. He restores Edwards to active duty and convinces the mayor to lift the ban on puppet cops, welcoming Phil back on the force. Phil asks Bubbles out on a date, and she accepts.
==Cast== * [[Melissa McCarthy]] as Detective Connie Edwards, Phil’s ex-partner. * [[Maya Rudolph]] as Bubbles, Phil’s secretary. * [[Joel McHale]] as Special Agent Campbell, an FBI agent. * [[Elizabeth Banks]] as Jenny Peterson, a burlesque dancer and Phil's ex-girlfriend, the sole human member of ''The Happytime Gang''. * [[Leslie David Baker]] as Lt. Banning, Edwards' police superior. * [[Michael McDonald (comedian)|Michael McDonald]] as Ronovan Scargle, the CEO of the Television Network which produced ''The Happytime Gang''. * Cynthy Wu as Brittenie Marlowe, Larry Phillips' girlfriend. * [[Mitch Silpa]] as Tommy, a criminal who sells puppet parts on the black market. * [[Hemky Madera]] as Tito, a criminal who purchases puppet parts on the black market. * [[Jimmy O. Yang]] as Officer Delancey, a police officer. * [[Ryan Gaul]] as Officer Milligan, a police officer. * [[Fortune Feimster]] as Robin, a weed dealer and fan of ''The Happytime Gang''. * [[Ben Falcone]] as Donny, an LAPD desk worker.
===Puppeteers=== * [[Bill Barretta]] as Phil Phillips, disgraced ex-cop who is now a [[private investigator]]. He was the first puppet to become a police officer. ** Barretta also performs Junkyard ** Barretta also performs Boar, a [[common warthog]]. * Dorien Davies as Sandra White (née Jakoby), a puppet who hires Phil to investigate a case for her. * [[Kevin Clash]] as Lyle, an actor on ''The Happytime Gang'' who is now a drug lord. ** Clash also performs Mr. Bumblypants, a [[rabbit]] actor on ''The Happytime Gang'' who has a pornography addiction. * [[Drew Massey]] as Goofer, an actor on ''The Happytime Gang'' who is now homeless and addicted to sugar. ** Massey also performs Vinny, a [[vulture]] who works at a porn shop. * Ted Michaels as Ezra, an actor on ''The Happytime Gang'' and Cara’s cousin. ** Michaels also performs a sexist thug. * Colleen Smith as Cara, an actress on ''The Happytime Gang'' and Ezra’s cousin. ** Smith also performs a Dalmatian and Carol * [[Alice Dinnean]] and Donna Kimball as Sheila and Diane (the "Rotten Cotton Girls"), puppet prostitutes and strippers. ** Kimball also performs an unnamed [[Cattle|cow]] at a porn shop and Roxy. * [[Brian Henson]] as a [[crab]] in a trash can. * [[Allan Trautman]] as an [[octopus]] at a porn shop. ** Trautman also performs the puppet doctor that operated on Connie. * [[Victor Yerrid]] as Larry "Shenanigans" Phillips, Phil's older brother and an actor on ''The Happytime Gang'' who played a police officer. ** Yerrid also performs an old man.
In addition, Henson makes an on-screen cameo in a photograph in Connie's apartment.
==Production== [[File:HappytimeMurdersConceptArt2.jpg|thumb|210px|left|Concept art depicting Phil, the grizzled central puppet character]] Announced in 2008 as being in development at [[The Jim Henson Company]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/happytime-murders-a-muppet-noir/ |first=Peter |last=Sciretta |title=Happytime Murders - A Muppet Noir |website=[[/Film]] |date=October 15, 2008 |accessdate=July 8, 2017}}</ref> the film was picked up two years later by [[Lionsgate]] with a targeted January 2011 start date.<ref>{{cite web|last=Graham |first=Bill |url=http://collider.com/happytime-murders-jim-henson-todd-berger/ |title=Lionsgate Picks Up Dark Jim Henson Co. Puppet Film HAPPYTIME MURDERS |publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]] |work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |date=October 12, 2010 |accessdate=July 8, 2017}}</ref> At the time, [[Cameron Diaz]] had been offered a lead role in the film.<ref>{{cite web|last=Graham |first=Bill |url=http://collider.com/cameron-diaz-happytime-murders-dark-henson-puppet-movie/ |title=Cameron Diaz Offered Role in Dark Henson Puppet Film THE HAPPYTIME MURDERS |publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]] |work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |date=November 9, 2010 |accessdate=July 8, 2017}}</ref> Diaz dropped out and [[Katherine Heigl]] entered into talks to replace her.<ref>{{cite web|last=Chitwood |first=Adam |url=http://collider.com/katherine-heigl-happytime-murders-al-pacino-despicable-me-2/ |title=Katherine Heigl Up for Film Noir Puppet Comedy THE HAPPYTIME MURDERS; Al Pacino Set as Villain in DESPICABLE ME 2 |publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]] |work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |date=February 3, 2012 |accessdate=July 8, 2017}}</ref>
In July 2015, it was announced that [[STX Entertainment]] had picked up the film rights to ''The Happytime Murders'' (Lionsgate having lost them) and put the film in active development, with script revisions by Erich and Jon Hoeber.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/jim-hensons-crime-puppet-movie-807262 |title=Jim Henson's Crime Puppet Movie Finds New Home at STX |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |date=July 7, 2015 |accessdate=July 8, 2017 |first=Borys |last=Kit}}</ref> In April 2016, [[Jamie Foxx]] entered negotiations to star in the film.<ref name="FoxxCast">{{cite news|last1=Busch|first1=Anita|title=Jamie Foxx Negotiating To Star In ‘The Happytime Murders’ At STX|url=http://deadline.com/2016/04/jamie-foxx-happytime-murders-movie-stx-1201745407/|accessdate=April 28, 2016|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|date=April 27, 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, it was revealed that [[Melissa McCarthy]] had signed on to star in the film instead, as well as to contribute minor, uncredited rewrites to the film's screenplay.<ref name="McNary">{{cite web|last=McNary|first=Dave|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/maya-rudolph-melissa-mccarthy-happytime-murders-1202536883/|title=Maya Rudolph to Reunite With Melissa McCarthy in ‘Happytime Murders’|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=August 23, 2017|accessdate=August 23, 2017}}</ref> This was followed by [[Maya Rudolph]] being added in August,<ref name="McNary"/> and in September, [[Elizabeth Banks]],<ref name="BanksCast">{{cite news|last1=Hipes|first1=Patrick|title=Elizabeth Banks Joins Gang For ‘The Happytime Murders’|url=http://deadline.com/2017/09/elizabeth-banks-happytime-murders-cast-melissa-mccarthy-stxfilms-1202168833/|accessdate=September 13, 2017|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|date=September 13, 2017}}</ref> [[puppeteer]] [[Bill Barretta]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/elizabeth-banks-joins-stxs-puppet-comedy-happytime-murders-1038674 |title=Elizabeth Banks Joins STX's Puppet Comedy 'Happytime Murders' |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |date=September 13, 2017 |accessdate=February 26, 2018 |first=Ashley |last=Lee}}</ref> and [[Joel McHale]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/joel-mchale-joins-melissa-mccarthy-puppet-comedy-happytime-murders-1039688 |title=Joel McHale Joins Melissa McCarthy in Puppet Comedy 'Happytime Murders' (Exclusive) |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |date=September 15, 2017 |accessdate=February 26, 2018 |first=Borys |last=Kit}}</ref> all officially joined the cast.
[[Principal photography]] on the film began in [[Los Angeles, California]] on September 11, 2017.<ref name="BanksCast" /> The film had a production budget in the range of $40–47 million, with McCarthy getting paid between $10–17.5 million.<ref name=opening/>
There are a total of 125 puppets in the film, with 40 created specifically for it.<ref name="TriviaFacts">{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/what-is-the-happytime-murders/ |title=‘The Happytime Murders': 25 Things to Know about the Long-Developing R-Rated Puppet Movie|first=Christina|last=Radish|date=July 12, 2018|work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]]|publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]]|accessdate=August 22, 2018}}</ref> To accommodate the puppeteers, all of the sets were built up so that the puppeteers could stand on the floor, since their optimum way to operate the puppets is if they are standing with straight arms. Because the floor of the sets came up in pieces, the human actors had a two-foot margin to stay on their path.<ref name="TriviaFacts"/> Visual effects supervisor Sam Nicholson said the film had many VFX challenges, specifiyng, "It’s some of the most complex work that we’ve ever done because, in one shot you could have a combination of principal photography done at 8K and then puppets on greenscreen being puppeteered by four puppeteers for each puppet. So if you have, say, six puppets in a scene, you’ve got 24 puppeteers operating them, and these are all people dressed in green suits. And then you have all the rod removal of those puppets, and then you have avatars or CG puppets that are standing right next to the real puppets."<ref name="VFXVoice">{{cite web|url=http://vfxvoice.com/the-puppet-masters-behind-the-happytime-murders/ |title=The Puppet Masters Behind THE HAPPYTIME MURDERS|first=Ian|last=Failes|date=September 4, 2018|work=VFXVoice.com|accessdate=September 4, 2018}}</ref>
==Release== ''The Happytime Murders'' was released to cinemas by [[STX Entertainment]] on August 24, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/mile-22-happytime-murders-new-release-dates/ |title=STX Films Shifts ‘Mile 22’ and ‘The Happytime Murders’ Release Dates|work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]]|publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]]|accessdate=August 22, 2018|first=Matt|last=Goldberg|date=June 22, 2018}}</ref> The film was originally scheduled for August 17, 2018, but was pushed back a week.<ref>{{cite web|first=JD |last=Knapp |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/mollys-game-happytime-murders-melissa-mccarthy-stx-sets-dates-1202486046/ |title=STX Sets Dates for ‘Molly’s Game’ and ‘Happytime Murders’ |publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=July 1, 2017 |accessdate=July 8, 2017}}</ref>
The first official [[Trailer (promotion)#Rating cards|red-band trailer]] was released on May 18, 2018, with select screenings of ''[[Deadpool 2]].''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://screenrant.com/happytime-murders-trailer-red-band/ |first=Sandy |last=Schaefer |date=May 18, 2018 |title=Happytime Murders Trailer: Melissa McCarthy's Filthy Puppet Noir |work=[[Screen Rant]]|accessdate=August 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/the-happytime-murders-trailer/ |title=Melissa McCarthy Snorts Ecstasy and Punches Puppets in NSFW ‘The Happytime Murders’ Trailer|work=[[Collider (website)|Collider]]|publisher=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex Media]]|accessdate=August 22, 2018|first=Haleigh|last=Foutch|date=May 18, 2018}}
The Happytime Murders will be released on [[Blu-Ray]] and [[DVD]] December 4th 2018. </ref>
== Home media == The Happytime Murders was released on Digital HD on November 20, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.dvdsreleasedates.com/movies/8766/the-happytime-murders|title=The Happytime Murders DVD Release Date December 4, 2018|website=DVDs Release Dates|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-28}}</ref> The Happytime Murders will be released on Blu-Ray & DVD on December 4, 2018 by [[Universal Pictures Home Entertainment]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.dvdsreleasedates.com/movies/8766/the-happytime-murders|title=The Happytime Murders DVD Release Date December 4, 2018|website=DVDs Release Dates|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-28}}</ref>
==Reception== ===Box office === ''The Happytime Murders'' has grossed $20.7 million in the United States and Canada, and $6.8 million in other territories, for a worldwide total of $27.5 million, against a production budget of around $40 million.<ref name="BOM">{{cite web |url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=thehappytimemurders.htm|title=The Happytime Murders (2018)|website=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=September 19, 2018}}</ref> In the United States and Canada, ''The Happytime Murders'' was released alongside ''[[A.X.L.]]'', and was projected to gross $13–15 million from 3,225 theaters in its opening weekend.<ref name=preview>{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-fi-ct-movie-projector-happytime-murders-20180822-story.html|title=Filthy puppet movie 'Happytime Murders' to battle 'Crazy Rich Asians' at the box office|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|first=Ryan |last=Faughnder|date=August 22, 2018|accessdate=August 22, 2018}}/</ref> The film grossed $950,000 from Thursday night previews, better than the $700,000 made by McCarthy's ''[[Life of the Party (2018 film)|Life of the Party]]'' three months prior. It went on to debut to $9.5 million, marking the lowest opening of McCarthy's career as a lead.<ref name=opening>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2018/08/melissa-mccarthy-happytime-murders-crazy-rich-asians-meg-weekend-box-office-1202451694/|title=‘Why ‘Happytime Murders’ Reps A Solo Career B.O. Low For Melissa McCarthy In A ‘Crazy Rich’ Weekend – Update|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |publisher=[[Penske Business Media]] |date=August 26, 2018 |first=Anthony |last= D'Alessandro |accessdate=August 26, 2018}}</ref> It fell 54% in its second weekend to $4.4 million, finishing eighth.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2018/08/crazy-rich-asians-operation-finale-the-meg-labor-day-weekend-box-office-1202454590/|title=‘Crazy Rich Asians’ Accumulates Wealth Over Labor Day With $116M+ Total; Bigger Than ‘The Help’ & ‘The Butler’|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |publisher=[[Penske Business Media]] |date=September 2, 2018 |first=Anthony |last= D'Alessandro |accessdate=September 2, 2018}}</ref>
===Critical response=== {{expand section|date=August 2018}} On review aggregator [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film holds an approval rating of 23% based on 216 reviews, with an average rating of 3.8/10. The website's critical consensus reads, "''The Happytime Murders'' wastes its intriguingly transgressive premise on a witless comedy that blindly pushes buttons instead of attempting to tell an entertaining story."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_happytime_murders_2017|title=The Happytime Murders (2018)|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|accessdate=December 3, 2018}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film has a weighted average score of 27 out of 100, based on 48 critics, indicating "generally unfavorable reviews".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/the-happytime-murders|title=The Happytime Murders Reviews|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|work=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=August 31, 2018}}</ref> Audiences polled by [[CinemaScore]] gave the film an average grade of "C–" on an A+ to F scale, the lowest of McCarthy's career as a lead, while [[PostTrak]] reported filmgoers gave it an "awful" 58% overall positive score.<ref name=opening/>
Sarah Melton from ''[[Exclaim!]]'' gave the film a rating of 2/10, saying, "''The Happytime Murders'' hardly feels like a fitting extension of Henson's muppet legacy. Not because it's thoroughly vulgar and dirty, but because that's all it is."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Melton |first1=Sarah |title='The Happytime Murders' Offers Viewers a Very Unhappy Time |url=https://exclaim.ca/film/article/the_happytime_murders_offers_viewers_a_very_unhappy_time-directed_by_brian_henson |work=[[Exclaim!]] |accessdate=August 23, 2018 |date=August 23, 2018}}</ref> Jess Fenton for ''Switch'' wrote "...I adored the concept, I loved the cast, the fact that this was directed by Jim Henson’s son made me giddy, and yet... I did not like this movie. Hate is too strong a word, however I was deeply disappointed, underwhelmed, my sides were left unsplit."<ref name="SWITCH.">{{cite web|title=Film review: The Happytime Murders - Filthy felt|url=https://www.maketheswitch.com.au/article/review-the-happytime-murders-filthy-felt|work=SWITCH.|accessdate=September 3, 2018|date=August 23, 2018|first=Jess |last=Fenton|publisher=Midnight Productions}}</ref>
==Lawsuit== In May 2018, [[Sesame Workshop]], the organization behind the production of the television series ''[[Sesame Street]]'', filed a lawsuit against STX Productions for using their trademark in a film they have no involvement with, including the tagline "No Sesame, all Street". They alleged that associating a children’s program with an adult comedy would smear the former's reputation as well as confuse individuals. In response, STX issued a statement indicating their persistence to keep the marketing for the film unchanged.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://variety.com/2018/film/news/sesame-street-stx-happytime-murders-1202822955/ |first=Ricardo |last=Lopez |date=May 25, 2018 | title = ‘Sesame Street’ Creators Sue STX Entertainment Over Marketing for ‘The Happytime Murders’ |publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|accessdate=August 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Sesame Street sues over violent, puppet-based Happytime Murders film |date=May 26, 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-44263925 |publisher=[[BBC]] |work=[[BBC News]] | access-date=May 27, 2018 }}</ref> On May 30, 2018, the lawsuit was rejected by the presiding judge for the case, with STX issuing a brief statement soon thereafter: {{Quote|“We fluffing love ''Sesame Street'' and we're obviously very pleased that the ruling reinforced what STX's intention was from the very beginning — to honor the heritage of [[The Jim Henson Company]]'s previous award-winning creations while drawing a clear distinction between any [[The Muppets|Muppets]] or ''Sesame Street'' characters and the new world Brian Henson and team created. We believe we accomplished that with the very straightforward NO SESAME, ALL STREET tagline. We look forward to continued happytimes as we prepare to release ''Happytime Murders'' this summer.”<ref>{{cite web|url =http://deadline.com/2018/05/happytime-murders-lawsuit-sesame-street-melissa-mccarthy-stx-1202398325/ |title=‘Happytime Murders’ Lawsuit: Judge Kicks ‘Sesame Street’ Bosses’ Grouchy Case To The Curb|first1=Dominic |last1=Patten |first2=Erik |last2=Pedersen|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Penske Business Media]]|date=May 30, 2018|accessdate=May 30, 2018}}</ref>}}
Some subsequent television spots for the film made references to the lawsuit by starting the ads with "From the studio that was sued by ''Sesame Street''...".<ref>{{cite web|title=NSFW Happytime Murders Trailer Gets Dirty and Depraved with Puppets|url=https://movieweb.com/happytime-murders-trailer-2-red-band/|website=[[MovieWeb]]|publisher=Watchr Media|first=Kevin |last=Burwick|accessdate=August 23, 2018|date=August 13, 2018}}</ref>

page.title: The Sacred Order of Saint Dumas

revision.text:
{{Infobox comics organization <!--Wikipedia:WikiProject Comics--> | name = | image = <!-- file name format only --> | imagesize = <!-- default 250 --> | caption = | publisher = [[DC Comics]] | debut = ''Batman: Sword of Azrael'' #1 (Oct 1992) | creators = [[Dennis O'Neil]] | type = Religious Warrior Sect | business = | organisation = | organization = y | cat = secret societies | subcat = DC Comics | hero = | villain = | sortkey = Sacred Order of Saint Dumas }} '''The Sacred Order of Saint Dumas''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|s|æ|n|d|uː|ˈ|m|ɑː}} {{respell|SAN|doo|MAH}}) is a fictional group in the mythos of [[DC Comics|DC Comic's]] [[Batman]]. Created by writer [[Dennis O'Neil]] and introduced in the first issue of the ''Sword of Azrael'' arc, the Order is a deviant faction of the [[Knights Templar]] from which the mantle of [[Azrael (comics)|Azrael]] originates.
==Publication History== The Order of Saint Dumas first appeared in ''Batman: Sword of Azrael'' #1 and were created by [[Dennis O'Neil]].
==Fictional History== The Order of Saint Dumas was originally a part of the [[Knights Templar]], a group of warrior-monks that were formed during the [[Crusades]] originally to protect pilgrims journeying to the Holy Land, and who grew quite powerful before being disbanded. The members of the Order had a falling out with the other Templars and formed their own group, named for their leader Dumas ("who nobody else has ever accused of being a Saint"). The centuries-old villain [[Ra's al Ghul]] once had "an adventure" with Dumas, and Ra's later described the founder of the Order as "...[a] vicious man, an insane fanatic."<ref name="Manhunter28">''Manhunter'' vol. 3 #28</ref> The Order eventually stole Ra's al Ghul's Wheel of Plagues which contains a record of biological weapons.<ref>[[Batman: Legacy]]''</ref> Ra's al Ghul himself also took their precious battle armor called the Suit of Sorrows to pass as a family heirloom.<ref>''Detective Comics'' #842</ref>
The Order of Saint Dumas enriched itself during the Crusades and then went into hiding. It devoted itself to the teachings of Dumas. The order's first champion was an Asian man named Stephen Forrest Lee, the assassin known to [[Manhunter (comics)#Mark Shaw|Mark Shaw]] as Dumas. The failure of this champion splintered the Order of Saint Dumas.<ref name="Manhunter28"/>
===Splinter Branches=== The main branch retreated and the violent splinter elements created a new champion called [[Azrael (comics)|Azrael]], a hereditary title given to the splinter order's near-superhuman enforcer and assassin. Members of the splinter order enlarged the organization's power by killing their enemies, hoarding knowledge and kidnapping some of the greatest thinkers in the world. The order also spread [[disinformation]] to ensure that the theories of the kidnapped geniuses would look so silly that nobody would miss them or examine their research. A recent Azrael named [[Azrael (comics)|Jean-Paul Valley]] eventually destroyed the splinter group.<ref name="Manhunter28" />
In ''Detective Comics'' #842, it is revealed that there is another splinter faction called the Order of Purity.
===A New Champion=== The main branch of the Order of Saint Dumas recruited former Manhunter [[Manhunter (comics)#Mark Shaw|Mark Shaw]] to be their new champion.<ref name="Manhunter28" />
==Known Members== * '''Brother Rollo''' - Head of the Order of St. Dumas. * '''Brother Umberto''' * '''Brother Zoo''' - A member of the Order of St. Dumas who created the genetically-altered beasts in their possession. * '''Daniel Maris''' * '''[[Azrael (comics)|Jean-Paul Valley]]''' * '''Ludovic Valley''' - The father of Jean-Paul Valley who was his predecessor in the Azrael mantle. * '''[[Azrael (comics)|Michael Lane]]''' * '''Nomoz''' - A dwarf who was created by the Order of St. Dumas. * '''Sister Lilhy''' * '''Gray Abbott''' - scientist who creates the Azraels
==In Other Media== ===Television=== The Order of St. Dumas appears in Season 2 of ''[[Gotham (TV series)|Gotham]]''. They are depicted as a religious sect founded by the patron saint of the Dumas family centuries earlier. When Caleb Dumas is falsely accused for sexual assault by Celestine Wayne, Jonathan Wayne used a knife to cut off Caleb's right hand. Afterwards, the Dumas family is discredited for their role in the founding of the city where most of them took refuge with the Order of St. Dumas in Europe while the remaining ones in Gotham City had their last names changed to '''Galavan'''. Centuries later, the Order of St. Dumas begins to enact their elaborate plan to atone for the actions of the Wayne family, and destroy and rebuild Gotham. They pull strings so that Caleb's descendant Theo Galavan ([[James Frain]]) becomes the mayor of Gotham City. Upon gaining public trust, Galavan carries out the plan by framing [[Penguin (comics)|Oswald Cobblepot]] for his crimes, obtaining the knife used on Caleb Dumas and giving it to an elite member named Father Creel ([[Ron Rifkin]]), and kidnapping [[Batman|Bruce Wayne]] so that the Order of St. Dumas members can sacrifice Wayne. Before Father Creel can sacrifice the boy using the same knife that was used on Caleb Dumas, [[James Gordon (Gotham)|James Gordon]], Oswald Cobblepot and Cobblepot's gang, interrupt the ceremony and save Wayne. During a confrontation, all of the members of the Order of St. Dumas that were present were killed in the ensuing battle.<ref>{{Cite episode|title=Rise of the Villains: Worse Than a Crime|series=Gotham (TV series)|serieslink=Gotham (TV series)|network=Fox|airdate= November 30, 2015|season=2|number=11}}</ref> Later in the season, Galavan is resurrected by Hugo Strange ([[BD Wong]]) as the villain [[Azrael (comics)|Azrael]].
===Video Games=== * The Sacred Order of St. Dumas is mentioned in ''[[Batman: Arkham City]]''. It had long wanted to be the guiding force against crime and corruption in Gotham City. When news came that Batman was rumored to be currently in Arkham City, the Order of St. Dumas jumped at the opportunity. Sending Azrael out to earn Batman's trust, the Order provided the Dark Knight with a cryptic message that would come true 9 months later. * The Sacred Order of St. Dumas is mentioned in ''[[Batman: Arkham Knight]]''. On the night of Scarecrow's revenge amongst all the chaos caused by him and [[Jason Todd|Arkham Knight]], the Order of St. Dumas finally decided to make their move. They sent Azrael to trick Batman and kill him so that they could take his place. Growing suspicious of Azrael and the Order's motives, Batman discovered the truth of their motives when the Order has planted a microchip in his brain to influence his actions. This leads to a confrontation at Oracle's Clock Tower with two different outcomes: :: If Azrael chooses to kill Batman, he attacks the hero with the Sword of Sin, but is subdued by Batman and taken to the Gotham City Police Department where he is incarcerated alongside [[Scarecrow (DC Comics)|Scarecrow]]'s co-conspirators. Lane reveals himself to be a religious zealot, completely in line with the Order of St. Dumas's creed, claiming evil has flourished under Batman's tenure and he must die so that divine justice can save the city. Azrael develops an animosity toward [[Deacon Blackfire]] as both of them consider themselves to be God's rightful representative. :: If Azrael chooses to spare Batman, he enters the elevator to leave the Clock Tower either immediately or after picking up and breaking his own sword (it seemed to have some kind of control over him). Proud, Batman shakes his hand after he enters the elevator telling Lane that he made the right choice. Azrael explains that he only follows the will of God and not the manipulations of man while also stating that the Order of St. Dumas will answer for their crimes.
